intro: Metabolos rugosus var. flavescens, commonly known as the golden rough metabolos, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green foliage and showy, clustered inflorescences. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features rough, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks.
